properties.description: Posted by Oryonlbrooks5145 Mariette Street, Montreal, CanadaI lived here for three years as a young mother my oldest son and daughter. We slid down slides, swung on a metal chicken and ice skated a lot. Long winters! We made an indoor hopscotch in the entry way with masking tape, cooked a lot and went to the library.

Posted by Oryonlbrooks6710 General Diaz, New Orleans, LouisianaMy daughter was born while I lived here. Endless walks with her in the backpack and my son in the stroller to feed "our" horse, Napoleon at City Park. Then 1/2 hour back the other way to the Park on the edge of Lake Pontchartrain where I spent countless hours pushing them in swings. So many good friends. Such good food.

properties.name: Cambridge University Botanic Garden
properties.description: Posted by OryonlbrooksOryon 1985: Studied at Cambridge University in England for a summer. I wasn\'t quite as studious as I should have been. But I do remember my professor Mac Dowdle\'s sideburns. They tufted off his cheeks like cumulus nimbus clouds ready to blow away from his red apple cheeks. Went to Greece after that for a month because it was the place I could travel and stay the longest for the least amount of money.

properties.name: Duc de Lorraine
properties.description: Posted by Oryonlbrooks5145 Mariette, Montreal, CanadaOryon 1989-1993: Lived in Montreal as a young mother to my two oldest children. We slid down slides, swung on metal chickens, ice skated, walked and walked, took the metro to my son\'s violin lessons next to Duc de Lorraine pastry shop where they have the best Pain au Chocolat on in North America. Long winters, beautiful summers. In the winter we kept busy inside making hopscotches on the entryway floor out of masking tape, reading tons of books, playing with friends and going to the library.

properties.name: East Millcreek
properties.description: Posted by Oryonlbrooks3250 Millcreek Road, Salt Lake City, Utah1962-1988: The place of my childhood and growing up under the wing of a wonderful mother. My son was born here in Salt Lake City. Playing kick the can, jump rope, lighting fire crackers, flying kites. Laying on freshly mowed grass. Swimming. That green strip of trees you see on the map shows the Millcreek River that ran behind my house. My brothers and sisters and I spent countless hours in the gully fishing with safety pins and cheese, building forts and sleeping in them with a b.b. gun "in case of robbers," building dams and swinging on a rope swing over the river. Swimming in our pool. You can see my high school at the bottom center of the photo, and my junior high to the left of it with the grassy track. The best neighborhood in the world. People who cared. My father died when I was six and this was a good place to be. Graduated from the University of Utah with a degree in English with an emphasis in Creative Writing. My poetry teacher, poet laureate Mark Strand told my a poem I had written sounded like a Hallmark Card. Moved to New Orleans in 1988

properties.name: New Orleans City Park
properties.description: Posted by Oryonlbrooks6710 General Diaz, New OrleansOryon 1988-1990: Lived in New Orleans where my daughter was born on a fragrant autumn day when the Sweet Magnolias had just come into bloom and smelled like apricot jam being bottled. Daily trips with my daughter on my back and my son in the stroller--15 minutes one way to City Park where we\'d feed "our" horse Napoleon. Then 1/2 hour walk to the park at Lake Pontchartrain where I pushed the children for hours on the swings. Good food. Great neighbors. Fleas. Robbery. Jazz Festival. Cicadas buzzing.

properties.name: Oryon L. Brooks
properties.description: Posted by OryonlbrooksOrem, Utah

properties.name: Oryon's Favorite Place
properties.description: Posted by OryonlbrooksRichmond, VermontOryon 1993-2001: Lived here as a less-young mother raising my now three children. My third child was born here. So many friends, a close-knit community, the best library a child could wish for, the Green Mountains out our front window, Prairie Home Companion on Saturday nights, very, very cold winters, the children learning to ski at Cochran\'s ski hill. My heart is still there. For many reasons.

properties.name: Paris
properties.description: Posted by Oryonlbrooks12 rue des Barres, Paris, FranceOryon May 1998, March 2005: I took a five-day trip to Paris when my divorce was final. All by myself, which wasn\'t too frightening at all since I speak French. Stayed at the most wonderful hostel just a stone\'s throw from Notre Dame Cathedral. You can see on the map that I just had to cross a bridge to get to the island, Isle de la Cite where Notre Dame stands. L\'Orangerie, the Louvre (too big to see in such a short time. Augh!), buying scarves at Sur un Air d\'Opera on 35, avenue de l\'Opera, going to a Pat Metheny concert and meeting he and Lyle Mays afterwards. Wrote the forward to a book while there. Took the train out to the Chateau de Versailles. Be warned, carry your own water and hope you have a big bladder. Seeing the Eiffel Tower from Plaza Trocadero across the Seine. Went to Paris again in 2005. Stayed at a hotel that looked out onto the Eiffel Tower, which was really something to see from my window at night. Le Notre pastry shop on rue Cler. The Costa Rica is the best pastry I\'ve ever had. Well, other than a good croissant aux pates d\'amandes.

properties.name: Taipei Language Institute
properties.description: Posted by OryonlbrooksTaichung,TaiwanOryon 1985: Rode my bike from job to job teaching English in Taichung, Taiwan. Studied Chinese for 3 hours a day at the Taipei Language Institute and learned enough to make waiters laugh and find my way over the East West Highway, then on to Orchid Island where I ate the best Cuttlefish of my life.
